title: Mechanism-Based Learning Design for Understanding Spatial Causal Relationships

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: Developing linguistic analysis skills of spatial causality to improve workplace communication

learning_goals: Learners can present three or more mechanisms that explain causal relationships separated in physical/attentional spaces.
Learners can write a report analyzing spatial causal relationships in real-world work scenarios using mechanism-based explanations.
Learners can develop a prototype revising their causal relationship explanation methods based on peer feedback.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
